intro: Cineraria canadensis, commonly known as Canadian cineraria, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other moist habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
